[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/intrinsics.rs] [Function: populate_intrinsic_decl()] [Error Continue Exploitation] The function uses 'continue' on errors rather than returning - can an attacker trigger multiple errors to skip validation for some mappings while others succeed, leaving partial/corrupted state? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/intrinsics.rs] [Function: populate_intrinsic_decl()] [is_move_fun Boolean Trust] The is_move_fun boolean from associated_funs determines validation path - if this map is corrupted or maliciously modified, can move functions be validated as spec functions or vice versa? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/intrinsics.rs] [Function: populate_intrinsic_decl()] [Spec Fun Table Lookup Race] Lines 208-250 lookup builder.parent.spec_fun_table with similar TOCTOU potential - can this cause spec function mappings to point to deleted functions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/intrinsics.rs] [Struct: IntrinsicsAnnotation] [ID Collision] The add_decl() method at line 271 generates IntrinsicId::new(self.decls.len()) - if decls are removed/cleared, can ID collisions occur when new declarations reuse old IDs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/intrinsics.rs] [Struct: IntrinsicsAnnotation] [Map Synchronization] Lines 272-279 insert into multiple maps (intrinsic_structs, intrinsic_move_funs, intrinsic_spec_funs, decls) - if any insert fails or panics mid-way, can maps become desynchronized causing lookup inconsistencies? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/intrinsics.rs] [Struct: IntrinsicsAnnotation] [Duplicate Key Overwrite] If the same QualifiedId is inserted multiple times via add_decl(), BTreeMap insert will silently overwrite - can this be exploited to replace legitimate intrinsic mappings with malicious ones? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/intrinsics.rs] [Function: add_decl()] [Atomic Transaction Failure] The add_decl() method performs multiple inserts without rollback - if the system crashes after partial inserts, can this leave corrupted state that causes subsequent intrinsic lookups to fail or return wrong results?
